Remote service sessions established by u.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4624 and Zeek conn.log for remote service connections (e.g., RDP, SSH ports). Establish baseline access patterns per user to systems they normally access. Identify users accessing systems outside their normal set or accessing an unusually high number of distinct systems in a short time period (e.g., using frequency analysis, correlation analysis between user/system pairs).

Execution of specific processes or comma.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for process creation. Look for specific commands or process names known to be used in session hijacking (e.g., tscon.exe) running with unusual parent processes or user contexts. Use pattern matching and potentially entropy measures on command lines to detect obfuscation attempts.
